description: Erection of hip to gable and rear dormer roof extensions (incorporating a juliet balcony), window to side elevation and installation of two front rooflights to facilitate loft conversion
decision_conditions: The proposed development, by reason of its excessive bulk, mass, scale and design, would result in harm to the character and appearance of the original building and the prevailing character of the surrounding area. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policies D3 of the London Plan 2021 and Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Council's Core Strategy 2012.

--- Officer Report ---IntroductionThis application is of a nature where the Council's Constitution delegates the authority to make the decision to Officers rather than it being decided by a Committee of Councillors.  Before preparing this summary report a Planning Officer has familiarised themselves with the application site, the relevant Development Plan policies and guidance, considered any relevant previous planning applications, and considered any comments made by those interested in the application such as consultees with specialist knowledge and nearby residents. By indicating that the development proposal complies with relevant Development Plan policies, the planning officer is taking into account the information submitted with the application, any previous relevant applications, any comments received in connection with the application and any other case specific considerations which are material to the decision.The Development Plan comprises:The London Plan 2021;RBK Core Strategy 2012;Kingston Town Centre Area Action Plan 2008; and,The South London Waste Plan 2022.This decision has been authorised by a Senior Officer (Authorising Officer) in the Development Management Service. Prior to endorsing the Planning Officer's recommendation, the Authorising Officer has familiarised themselves with the application site, the application documents, the relevant planning policies and guidance, any relevant history, and any representations received.Application SiteThe site comprises a commercial premises on Clarence Street in the designated Kingston Town Centre. The area is mixed in use.Consultation No response received.AssessmentThe application relates to the display of advertisements. The key considerations are Character and Appearance/AmenityPublic safetyCharacter and Appearance/AmenityThe signage would be on the front of the building. The building is one of a number of ground floor commercial units on Clarence Street which have contrasting styles of signage and methods of illumination. It is considered that the proposed internally illuminated fascia and projecting signage and vinyl signage would be of a sympathetic addition to and proportionate to the existing shop frontage and facade of the host property and would not detract from its character and appearance and the surrounding area.  The proposed illuminance levels of 350cd/sqm of the proposed signage is considered to be acceptable and would not result in any harmful light pollution.Public safetyThe proposed signage would be static and would not obscure any highway signs or impede pedestrian movement. The proposed signage would not prejudice highway safety. ConclusionIn conclusion the proposed signage would accord with policies D3 of the London Plan 2021 and CS8 and DM10 of the Council's adopted LDF Core Strategy.Details of the Application SubmissionIn accordance with the requirements of Local Government Act 1972 details of the application submission were available on the Council's website during the assessment of the application.https://www.kingston.gov.uk/info/200155/planning_applications_and_permissions/263/find_a_planning_application_or_appeal--- Informatives ---Positive and ProactiveIn dealing with the application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive way.  We have made available detailed advice in the form or our statutory policies in the Core Strategy, Supplementary Planning Documents, Planning Briefs and other informal written guidance, as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably.
